The trial of accused murderer Robert Durst has been put on hold starting Monday amid the coronavirus pandemic.

“Due to concerns regarding the coronavirus/COVID-19, Judge Mark E. Windham has ordered that the People v. Robert Durst trial stands adjourned until April 6," Los Angeles Superior Court said in a statement Sunday.

Advertisement

It’s part of a temporary jury-trial suspension in Los Angeles County due to the spread of coronavirus, the court told the Daily News in a statement. The Court will begin scaling down operations Monday “to achieve social distancing in all 38 courthouses,” the statement said, with more public protection measures possibly on the way Monday or Tuesday.

“As the largest trial court in the nation, the Superior Court of Los Angeles County is methodically scaling back non-essential court operations as part of a phased approach,” Presiding Judge Kevin Brazile said in a statement. “We will continue to provide services for the most vulnerable in our communities and remain open to handle criminal matters subject to statutory deadlines.”

Advertisement

Police learned earlier Sunday that all jury trials would be suspended through at least March 30, CNN reported.

“Effective Monday, March 16, 2020, there will be a suspension of all jury trials, both those currently in progress, as well as those pending commencement, through March 30th,” read the memo, as Los Angeles Police Department spokesperson Josh Rubenstein confirmed to CNN Link: https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/15/us/california-jury-trials-suspended/index.html . “This notification applies to jury trials only.”

Durst, 76, is a multimillionaire charged with killing Susan Berman in late 2000, allegedly because she was set to incriminate him in the 1982 disappearance of his wife, Kathleen McCormack Durst, as CNN noted. Berman was his best friend. She was found dead in her apartment in Beverly Hills, and he was arrested and charged in March 2015, according to CNN.

A friend testified Thursday that McCormack foresaw her death and entreated a friend to make sure he saw justice.

Robert Durst’s wife Kathie Durst predicted he would kill her, friend testifies » Link: https://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/ny-robert-durst-trial-brother-in-law-20200312-wr24d4ud25f4zf5tccsppcpooq-story.html#nt=interstitial-manual

Durst has pleaded not guilty to murdering Berman to keep her from telling New York authorities what she knew about his wife’s disappearance. His trial in Berman’s death has been under way for about a week.

As part of the scaling-down process, new jurors won’t be summoned for at least the next 30 days, the court said, and trial judges for any jury trial can either continue at a later date or declare a mistrial.

More than 4,600 permanent employees work in the Superior Court of Los Angeles County system, the statement said, plus at least 550 judicial officers, serving a diverse population of more than 10 million people at 38 courthouses in 12 judicial districts.
